meanings.definition: The act or trade of making or repairing tinware.
meanings.sent1: Tinsmithing requires skill and precision to shape tin into useful items.
meanings.sent2: My grandfather learned tinsmithing from his father and made beautiful tin lanterns.
meanings.sent3: The town's annual tinsmithing competition always sparks friendly rivalry among the craftsmen.
meanings.sent4: Her tinsmithing was like magic, transforming dull metal into shining works of art.
meanings.sent5: The sound of tinsmithing echoed through the workshop, a symphony of hammer on metal.

meanings.definition: The work or products of a tinsmith.
meanings.sent1: The tinsmithing displayed at the fair showcased intricate designs and fine craftsmanship.
meanings.sent2: The shop featured a variety of tinsmithing, from practical pots to decorative ornaments.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed fascinated by the tinsmithing on the shelf, pawing at the shiny objects.
meanings.sent4: His collection of antique tinsmithing told stories of a bygone era, each piece unique.
meanings.sent5: The museum exhibit highlighted the evolution of tinsmithing techniques over the centuries.
